intro: Cyrtandra kealiae subsp. urceolata, commonly known as the Kāneakō plant, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive urn-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or red in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal mesic forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
